definition: the emperor/Your majesty the emperor/His imperial majesty
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
lit. a person before the legendary emperor Fuxi 伏羲[Fu2 Xi1]/person from ages immemorial/fig. untroubled person
see 皇帝不急太監急|皇帝不急太监急[huang2 di4 bu4 ji2 tai4 jian4 ji2]
pinyin: huang2 shang4 bu4 ji2 tai4 jian4 ji2

definition: see 皇帝不急太監急|皇帝不急太监急[huang2 di4 bu4 ji2 tai4 jian4 ji2]

sentences.english: The wife who becomes an emperor a full blood the greatly hugs in the bosom, pain not the desire living.
sentences.chinese: 大成皇上把沁滿鮮血的妻子摟在懷裏，痛不欲生。

sentences.english: You Majesty, Li Yifu often abuses his power to persecute his opponents.
sentences.chinese: 皇上，李義府他經常利用手中的權力迫害反對他的人。

sentences.english: You say, which emperor won't like this kind of official?
sentences.chinese: 你說哪個皇上不喜歡這樣的臣子啊？

sentences.english: Your Majesty, this is Qing's own idea. My father knows nothing about it.
sentences.chinese: 稟皇上，是青女自己的心意，與家父無關。

sentences.english: Lee Ji said that we were sent to the emperor was responsible for sweeping the road.
sentences.chinese: 李績說我們被派來就是負責替皇上掃馬路的。

sentences.english: The Emperor gave him the cross.
Two people constantly, the emperor heard great anger, ask less swim.
sentences.chinese: 二人不斷針鋒相對，皇上聽到大怒，問少遊意見。

sentences.english: Between two people talk, XiaoFei suddenly come to the emperor.
sentences.chinese: 兩人談話間，蕭妃忽然來找皇上。

sentences.english: "How did the Emperor ride, sir?" said the barber.
sentences.chinese: “先生，”那理髮師說，“皇上騎馬的本領高明吧？”

sentences.english: Your Majesty, nothing essential happening minister this forgave to quit.
sentences.chinese: 皇上，沒什麼事情臣這就告退了。

sentences.english: Emperor, do you still remember Yuhe Xia of the Damimg Lake?
sentences.chinese: 皇上，您還記得當年大明湖畔的夏雨荷嗎？

sentences.english: The zhen son borrow meaning is put forward to visit the emperor, the queens answer.
sentences.chinese: 貞兒借意提出探望皇上，皇后無奈應允。

sentences.english: The emperor trumped up a charge against him and confiscates all his property.
sentences.chinese: 皇上虛構了一項罪名給他，並且沒收了他的所有財產。

sentences.english: He came and cast the flag at the Emperor's feet.
sentences.chinese: 他把那面旗子奪來丟在皇上的跟前。

sentences.english: "But the emperor have nothing on! "said the child.
sentences.chinese: “但是皇上什麼也沒穿”這位孩子說道。

sentences.english: The emperor died suddenly, LiZhi, know that panic.
sentences.chinese: 皇上突然駕崩，李治等人知道後十分驚慌。

definition: courtier's or minister's form of address for the current Emperor
(literary) I, your servant (self-appellation of a lower-rank female)/(archaic) male and female slaves/subjects (of a ruler)
to enter the emperor's palace/(slang) to go to jail
I, me (self-referring by a widowed empress etc, used in historical novels and operas)
in Qing dynasty, Manchurian word for wife
Taishang Huang/Retired Emperor/father of the reigning emperor/fig. puppet master
